diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: ventilator-associated pneumonia, hypoxemic respiratory failure, bacterial/fungal peritonitis, cirrhosis, supraventricular tachycardia, hemoptysis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a month-long history of functional deterioration, weight loss, and abdominal tenderness, which together with imaging findings of free air and leukocytosis supported the diagnosis of perforated sigmoid diverticulitis leading to bacterial/fungal peritonitis.
